I was a Baltimore City Councilman leading efforts to divest pension funds from South Africa at the time and had been a devoted supporter of Mr. Mandela since my days at Morgan State University. His words keep me inspired today. #NelsonMandela
A champion for social justice, Mr. Mandela wrote me a simple yet powerful message while he was imprisoned: “Do not give up.”
Even further, President Mandela established the Truth and Reconciliation Commission to examine societal injustices that occurred during apartheid so that those injustices would not be repeated.

President Mandela ushered in a new era for South Africa, authorizing a new constitution for the country and its people while also leading the effort to improve overall living conditions for South Africans.

On this day in 1994, Nelson Mandela was inaugurated as the first Black president of South Africa. I had the great honor of attending this awe-inspiring ceremony and celebration as a guest of Mr. Mandela when he took office. https://t.co/JE2eok8V31

We must continue to strive for the justice they sought. #FreedomRiders

The Freedom Riders’ fearlessness serves as an inspiration to all, as these brave fighters for freedom were willing to risk their lives in the name of human rights, civil rights, and equal opportunity. Today and everyday, we recognize and honor the work of the Freedom Riders.
In the end, the Freedom Riders’ influence grew overwhelmingly strong and compelled the Kennedy administration to usurp any attempts by the states to segregate interstate transit terminals.

Among the Freedom Riders was my friend and colleague the late Honorable John Lewis. Despite enduring violence and mobs in retaliation to the activists’ efforts, the original thirteen riders inspired hundreds of new contributors to join the cause.

Sixty-one years ago today, 13 brave civil rights activists, the Freedom Riders, started protests in parts of the country that defiantly ignored the Supreme Court ruling which declared segregated interstate travel unconstitutional. https://t.co/jppz9j6yIl
